category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: I see 'SFC cannot repair files' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC cannot repair files. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: SFC cannot repair files - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Installation aborted during install' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Installation aborted during install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Installation aborted during install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Cannot upgrade build' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Cannot upgrade build. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Version / Build Upgrade Errors.
cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Cannot upgrade build - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: '0x800f081f missing sources' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: 0x800f081f missing sources. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0x800f081f missing sources - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: I see 'Update database corruption' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update database corruption. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update database corruption - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Slow update download — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow update download. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Slow update download - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Not enough space for feature update
user_error_text: Problem: Not enough space for feature update — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Not enough space for feature update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Not enough space for feature update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Unsupported CPU/TPM — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Unsupported CPU/TPM. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Unsupported CPU/TPM - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Undoing changes made to your computer
user_error_text: My system reports: Undoing changes made to your computer during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Undoing changes made to your computer. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Undoing changes made to your computer - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Windows not activated' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows not activated. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows not activated - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

symptoms: Symptoms: Failure configuring Windows updates. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Failure configuring Windows updates - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: Problem: Update service crashes — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update service crashes. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update service crashes - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Component store corruption during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Component store corruption. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Component store corruption - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Undoing changes made to your computer
user_error_text: I see 'Undoing changes made to your computer' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Undoing changes made to your computer. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Undoing changes made to your computer - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Low disk space blocking update' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low disk space blocking update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Low disk space blocking update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Windows not activated' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows not activated. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows not activated - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Incompatible driver blocks update' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Incompatible driver blocks update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Incompatible driver blocks update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Slow update download.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow update download. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Slow update download - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Windows update failed during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows update failed. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows update failed - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: 'DISM /RestoreHealth failure' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: DISM /RestoreHealth failure. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: DISM /RestoreHealth failure - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0x800f0831 missing .NET - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Driver not ready for this version
user_error_text: I see 'Driver not ready for this version' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver not ready for this version. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Driver not ready for this version - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Upgrade reverted to old build.
symptoms: Symptoms: Upgrade reverted to old build. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Version / Build Upgrade Errors.
cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Upgrade reverted to old build - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Recovery partition full during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Recovery partition full. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Recovery partition full - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Component store corruption during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Component store corruption. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

user_error_text: I see 'Infinite update loop' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Infinite update loop. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Infinite update loop - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: Problem: Windows Update service disabled — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update service disabled. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows Update service disabled - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Activation mismatch after update during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Activation mismatch after update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Activation mismatch after update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: Problem: SFC cannot repair files — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC cannot repair files. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: SFC cannot repair files - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Update keeps failing to start.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update keeps failing to start. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update keeps failing to start - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Low disk space blocking update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: I see 'Activation error during upgrade' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Activation error during upgrade. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Activation error during upgrade - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Servicing stack error — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Servicing stack error. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Servicing stack error - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: 'Windows Update service disabled' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update service disabled. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows Update service disabled - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Reserved partition full — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Reserved partition full. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Version / Build Upgrade Errors.
cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Reserved partition full - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Update stuck at 0%.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update stuck at 0%. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update stuck at 0% - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Insufficient space for install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Insufficient space for install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Insufficient space for install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: 0x80070020 file in use during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: 0x80070020 file in use. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0x80070020 file in use - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair.
symptoms: Symptoms: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: BIOS outdated for new build during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: BIOS outdated for new build. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: BIOS outdated for new build - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors

symptoms: Symptoms: DISM /RestoreHealth failure. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

log_snippet: BIOS outdated for new build - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Not enough space for feature update
user_error_text: I see 'Not enough space for feature update' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Not enough space for feature update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Not enough space for feature update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Installation aborted during install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Installation aborted during install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Installation aborted during install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: I see 'CBS corruption detected' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: CBS corruption detected. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: CBS corruption detected - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: I see 'Slow update download' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow update download. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Slow update download - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Reserved partition full' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Reserved partition full. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Version / Build Upgrade Errors.
cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Reserved partition full - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Windows not activated during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows not activated. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows not activated - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: I see 'SFC found corrupt files' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC found corrupt files. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: SFC found corrupt files - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Device driver causing rollback — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device driver causing rollback. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Device driver causing rollback - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: 'Cryptographic service failure' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Cryptographic service failure. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Cryptographic service failure - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Infinite update loop.
symptoms: Symptoms: Infinite update loop. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Infinite update loop - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

symptoms: Symptoms: Unsupported CPU/TPM. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Unsupported CPU/TPM - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: I see 'DISM source not found' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: DISM source not found. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: DISM source not found - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Temporary files too large.
symptoms: Symptoms: Temporary files too large. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Temporary files too large - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

error_name: Windows Setup failed in SAFE_OS phase
user_error_text: I see 'Windows Setup failed in SAFE_OS phase' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Setup failed in SAFE_OS phase. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Version / Build Upgrade Errors.
cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Update stuck at 0%.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update stuck at 0%. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update stuck at 0% - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: 'Component store corruption' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: Component store corruption. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Component store corruption - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: My system reports: Cryptographic service failure during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Cryptographic service failure. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Cryptographic service failure - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: I see 'Infinite update loop' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Infinite update loop. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Infinite update loop - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: 'DISM source not found' shows up and prevents installation.
symptoms: Symptoms: DISM source not found. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: DISM source not found - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures
user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: BITS service not running.
symptoms: Symptoms: BITS service not running. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures.
cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: BITS service not running - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Infinite update loop — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Infinite update loop. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Infinite update loop - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Insufficient space for install — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Insufficient space for install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Insufficient space for install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: 0x800f081f missing sources.
symptoms: Symptoms: 0x800f081f missing sources. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0x800f081f missing sources - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Installation aborted during install during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Installation aborted during install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Installation aborted during install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: I see 'BIOS outdated for new build' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: BIOS outdated for new build. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: BIOS outdated for new build - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

cause: Insufficient partition space, incompatible hardware, or failed setup phases.
step_1: Ensure adequate free space on system and reserved partitions; clean up disk.
step_2: Update BIOS/UEFI to the latest recommended version from your vendor.
step_3: Verify hardware meets the new build requirements (TPM, CPU compatibility).
step_4: Disconnect external drives and unnecessary devices during major upgrades.
step_5: Use Windows Update Assistant or Media Creation Tool for complex upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: 0xC004F074 KMS unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: 0xC004F074 KMS unavailable. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0xC004F074 KMS unavailable - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Update stuck at 0% — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update stuck at 0%. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: 0xC004F074 KMS unavailable - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Unsupported CPU/TPM.
symptoms: Symptoms: Unsupported CPU/TPM. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Driver / Compatibility Blocking Errors.
cause: Outdated or incompatible drivers block the update process or cause rollback.
step_1: Check Device Manager for drivers flagged with warnings and update or roll back as needed.
step_2: Temporarily remove problematic devices or update their drivers from OEM sites.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset drivers and storage controller drivers before major upgrades.
step_4: If a specific driver blocks an update, obtain a compatible driver version for the target build.
step_5: Use compatibility troubleshooting tools and review Windows release health for known blocker drivers.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Unsupported CPU/TPM - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Installation aborted during install during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Installation aborted during install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Installation aborted during install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Stuck on Preparing Automatic Repair - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors
user_error_text: My system reports: SFC cannot repair files during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC cannot repair files. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: SFC / DISM System File Corruption Errors.
cause: Corrupted system files or component store preventing update application.
step_1: Open elevated CMD: run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` then `sfc /scannow`.
step_2: If DISM fails, supply a known-good source (install.wim) via the /Source option.
step_3: Review CBS and DISM logs to identify problematic files and attempt manual replacement.
step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
step_5: Backup data and consider a clean install if corruption persists.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: SFC cannot repair files - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Update keeps failing to start — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update keeps failing to start. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update keeps failing to start - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: CBS corruption detected during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: CBS corruption detected. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Store / Component Servicing Errors.
cause: Component-based servicing corruption or missing update sources.
step_1: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair component store.
step_2: Check CBS logs for detailed errors and address missing source files.
step_3: Download missing packages from Microsoft Update Catalog if referenced by error.
step_4: Reset Windows Update components using the provided cleanup scripts.
step_5: If servicing stack is corrupted, install the latest SSU manually then retry updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: CBS corruption detected - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Low disk space blocking update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low disk space blocking update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

user_error_text: I see 'Insufficient space for install' when trying to update Windows.
symptoms: Symptoms: Insufficient space for install. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Disk Space / Storage Limit Errors.
cause: Not enough free space to download or apply updates, recovery partition too small.
step_1: Free up disk space on the system drive: delete temp files and uninstall unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and remove previous Windows installation files if safe.
step_3: Increase reserved partition size if necessary using disk management tools.
step_4: Move large personal files to external storage before attempting feature updates.
step_5: Consider upgrading to a larger system drive if updates consistently fail due to space.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Insufficient space for install - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Activation mismatch after update during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Activation mismatch after update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Licensing / Activation Errors.
cause: Activation or licensing issues blocking feature upgrades or changes.
step_1: Check activation status in Settings → Update & Security → Activation.
step_2: Run `slmgr.vbs /dlv` to view license details and error codes.
step_3: Ensure network access to KMS or organization activation servers if domain-activated.
step_4: Re-enter a valid product key or contact Microsoft support for activation help.
step_5: If activation blocks updates, resolve licensing issues before retrying feature upgrades.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Activation mismatch after update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: After checking for updates I get: Windows update failed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows update failed. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Installation Errors.
cause: Files in use, corrupted packages, or installation script failures.
step_1: Reboot and close all apps to free files that might be in use, then retry the update.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` and `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_3: Check for optional updates and install any prerequisite updates first.
step_4: Free up disk space and ensure antivirus is not blocking installer actions.
step_5: If installation repeatedly fails, create installation media and perform an in-place upgrade.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Windows update failed - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

user_error_text: My system reports: Update keeps failing to start during upgrade.
symptoms: Symptoms: Update keeps failing to start. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Windows Update Download Errors.
cause: Network issues, Windows Update cache corruption, or service problems preventing download.
step_1: Restart PC and ensure a stable internet connection; disable VPN/proxy temporarily.
step_2: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Windows Update).
step_3: Stop Windows Update and BITS services, clear SoftwareDistribution\Download folder, then restart services.
step_4: Temporarily disable third-party security software that may block downloads.
step_5: Try using the Update Assistant or download the update manually from Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Update keeps failing to start - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

category: Windows Update Service & Background Service Failures

cause: Windows Update / BITS / CryptSvc not running or corrupted update database.
step_1: Open services.msc and ensure Windows Update, BITS, and Cryptographic services are running.
step_2: Reset Windows Update components using recommended Microsoft scripts.
step_3: Repair the update database by renaming SoftwareDistribution and catroot2 folders and restarting services.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for service startup errors and address root causes.
step_5: If services repeatedly fail, perform an in-place repair or clean install.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.

user_error_text: Problem: Rollback after update — update won't complete.
symptoms: Symptoms: Rollback after update. Update stops, rolls back, or shows error codes; system may be unstable. Category: Update Configuration / Boot Phase Errors.
cause: Failure during restart phases due to driver/hardware conflicts or corrupted updates.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently added drivers or updates that may block setup.
step_2: Use System Restore to revert to a point before the update attempt, then retry.
step_3: Check disk health (chkdsk) and repair any disk errors before updating.
step_4: Disconnect non-essential peripherals during update to avoid driver conflicts.
step_5: If stuck in a loop, use recovery media to access advanced startup and rollback updates.
verification: Update completes successfully or rolls back cleanly; no recurring errors.
log_snippet: Rollback after update - WindowsUpdate log or CBS entry.

step_4: Perform an in-place upgrade repair if system files cannot be fixed.
